result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Donald J. Feurt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald J. Feurt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald J. Feurt was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling to include anger management.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Review on May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Review on February 7, 2018 at 08:30 am.
No Contest Plea entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. withholds adj. of guilt. Deferred Prosecution Ordered 2 years on Ct. 2; Filed agreement today.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Count 1, 4 & 5 Dismiss.  DPA on Count 2.  Plea to Count 3.  Victim rights met.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 3:
24 months Probation, concurrent
Submit to DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent to include anger managment.
AODA & treatment to include mental health treatment.  
$243.00 Fine/Costs fees and $200.00 DNA sample.  (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Henney gives status.  Matters are resolved, however defendant needs to execute the DPA on one of the matters.  Request 30 days out for deferred sentencing hearing.  Defendant has major medical issues to undergo in the next month.  State advises DPA could be done sooner, however if delay is necessary to work around medical issues, State does not object.  Court request Attorney Henney get a date from Br. 2, Judge Evenson.
Final pre-trial at 03-07-2016 01:00 pm
Jury trial at 03-16-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives status. Matters are close to resolution.  State has an unavailable witness, request reset of trial.  Attorney Henney agrees matter is close to resolution and does not object to trial being reset.  Court advises parties to contact Br. 2.
Final pre-trial at 12-14-2015 01:00 pm
Cover Letter from atty. Hoffman
Final pre-trial at 12-07-2015 01:00 pm
Jury trial at 12-17-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Donald J. Feurt appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke gives explanation for non appearance.  Request signature bond.  Court reinstates bond.  Return to JT calendar.

body

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is also hearing case 14CF437. No show by DE. State requesting warrant. Based on no show by the DE, court is authorizing warrant in each case. Court order forf. of cash bond in 14CF437.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-09-2015 11:00 am
Status conference at 07-10-2015 01:00 pm
Status conference at 07-07-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Henney states talked to JA in Br. 2 and set matter over to July.   Waiting for some medical reports.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference at 06-01-2015 01:00 pm

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Still waiting medical records.  State objects to any reset and requests warrant.  State states prior hearing Judge Evenson ordered DE to be here today.  Court leave to Judge Evenson and what to set for next.
Status conference on April 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Henney requests resets in both matters/matters are resolved.  Need time to obtain some medical records that haven't been received yet.  State objects to one month reset as requested.  Atty Henney responds.  Bonds continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Cover Letter from atty. Henney
Status conference on March 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on March 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Henney request more time to submit medical history and information.  Request FPT and JT.  Time limits continued waived.  Global offer was extended.  State request cases track.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.  Status hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Return date on February 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Henney gives status.  Matter not yet resolved.  New charges pending.  Remove from trial and pretrial for the new case.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on January 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Henney acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states case and appearances and states DE will waive prelim today.  DE states he is hard of hearing.  Court provides hearing device to DE but it doesn't seem to help.  Court advises parties will speak directly into the microphones and DE to let parties know if he can't hear them.  Court re-states case and appearances and status.  Atty Henney agrees the DE will waive the prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions the DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attonrey Henney gives status.  Likely to be a waiver of preliminary hearing.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Return date on September 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Henney gives status.  PTC was held with ADA Hoffman.  Awaiting discovery.  Request RD date. State agrees with 2 week reset.  Bond continues.  Time limits continued waived.  Return date scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Cover Letter from Attorney Henney to COC
Public Defender appointment
No contact w/ZE or his residence; Absolute Sobriety

Pre-trial conference on July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Return date on August 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request cash bond.  Gives prior criminal record.  Request signature bond.  Defendant does qualify.  Time limits waived.  $1,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No contact with Z.E. or his residence.  No violent or abusive contact with anyone else.  No weapons.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
